title: libcurl.dll is Missing?
body: I had to uninstall League for patching issues, and when I went to reinstall, I got the system error saying that the libcurl.dll is missing. I listened to what it told me, to uninstall, and it said the same thing the second time around. Please help me.

replies.body: There could be a security setting that is blocking from accessing the file, meaning it can't find it.  Try out each step of the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to make sure lead is added as an exception.  Let me know if that helps!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=H5n7G9j9,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-29T23:03:13.628+0000)
>
> There could be a security setting that is blocking from accessing the file, meaning it can't find it.  Try out each step of the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to make sure lead is added as an exception.  Let me know if that helps!

One of my friends offered to help, and he said something about a 0.0.0.86 folder that I need. I don't have that folder, I have 0.0.0.87. Could that be my problem?

I wouldn't risk modifying any files just in case it causes more issues, but you can repatch with our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to repair anything missing.  I still recommend going over the permissions guide to make sure game access is allowed.
